subject: Giants Game
event:
Life is meaningless and full of pain.

Suddenly it seems a thousand years ago when the G-Men were 5-0 and dominating.  What the hell happened?  Clearly I can't leave the country during football season.  My teams just seem to fall apart without me.

comments.article: we had to get back on top some time =) go broncos!
comments.subject: broncos

comments.article:
Yup. Sorry, George, but we needed the win pretty badly, too. Good to see the Broncos get their act together.

Look on the bright side, George--the Cowboys are leading the East. The same Cowboys that fall apart down the stretch. So hope isn't lost for the G-Men just yet.
comments.subject: Re: broncos

comments.article:
I too am bummed out about the G-Men's fall from grace.

At least I have Peyton to get me through the rest of the season. 10-0 baby!!

I swear that some of this are some rather questionable calls by the referees this season. I read through the new rules for this year esp. the ones having to do with roughing and helmet contact but a lot of the calls are very subjective and a number of the helmet hits have honestly been accidental but have lost games for teams in the end.
This is generally my boyfriend's reaction. Usually he needs a milkshake in these cases. It doesn't really heal the pain, but it's like a nice bandaide... :(
My Falcons are in the same boat.  I feel your pain.
I understand how you feel, although I watch college football. Alabama gave me a heart attack tonight when they were playing Auburn.

yes they did.

ingram got shut down

comments.upictitle: scholarinexile: Tomorrowland in Walt Disney World
comments.article: I feel your pain. I'm a Pittsburgher, and of late it seems like Big Ben has entirely forgotten how to play football, and the rest of our stars are benched with one injury or another.
You ain't kidding. Not to mention that fact that the Steelers have the worst special teams in the NFL, and possibly in the NFL's history, depending on if they allow any more TDs.
As a Chargers fan, I have to say that I was seriously rooting for your Giants while cooking Thanksgiving this year (while I usually hope that Eli will eat grass a few times).
I'm sorry that my Saints ruined this season for the entire state of New York.
WHO DAT SAY DEY GONNA BEAT MY SAINTS?
that was painful to read.

I live in the UK so often have to Sky+ (our Tivo) the games due to the late start times and watch them throughout the week, meaning alot of websites (including this one) are off-limits until around Wednesday or Thursday when I finally get all the games watched. So I know how difficult it is to avoid the results when you don't want to hear them.

Did you fly from Edinburgh to Belfast or did you get the ferry. If you got the ferry you'll have gone through my hometown of Stranraer, Scotland.
comments.subject: Glad you've caught up with the season

comments.article:
The papers here in Colorado seem to believe it was McDaniels R-rated nationally televised rant that finally turned the tide.

Our defense finally looked like it wasnt just a six week fluke but a real threat. Elvis lives!
At least you're not a Chicagoan anymore.  It's painful this season, and not just cuz the hawk is out.
comments.subject: Yeah right

comments.article:
Rofl! Funniest not a blog post ever! Like a Stark south of the Neck! You leave, they lose! Winter came!

E-A-G-L-E-S...who am I kidding, the Birds ain't gonna' win anything this season...life is meaningless and full of pain, ...probably.

Eagles will win the division. The Cowboys have some really tough games ahead in the Saints, Chargers, Giants (who are gonna be playing spoiler) and the Eagles.

What will be interesting is the Wildcard round. Will the Eagles and Cowboys play each other in back to back games?

Could be worse...you could be a Browns fan. At least the Giants have more wins than losses.

-H

comments.upictitle: Fabricati Diem, Pvnc: Hamilton: A.Burr and A.Ham
comments.article: Tynes is my fantasy team kicker. I am feeling your pain.

I have to preface this by saying I'm not much of a sports fan. If I'm going to watch one I would prefer football however. Yesterday was turkey day and my family wanted the game on.
Packers cleaned UP! Woo!
After the start of the season I am hoping for a quick painless end; I could not even finish the game the other night,
comments.subject: Giants

comments.article: Go Cowboys!... that is all.
Swept the state of NY.  Going to be in the dome Monday night for the push to 11-0!!!
comments.subject: GEAUX SAINTS!!

comments.article: You have no right to complain about a team's fall from glory until you are(or were) a raiders fan.
comments.subject: Don't Forget

comments.article: One of the worst displays I have seen put in by the Giants. The offense was clueless.
Things could be worse. A lot worse. *points to icon*

My condolences, sir! I'm just glad my Cardinals are proving that last season wasn't a complete fluke. (Mostly, maybe. I'm not a starry eyed home town fanboy, after all. We had a lot of years full of Suck.)

I believe it was in your absence that the Chiefs beat the Steelers.  It would seems that your absence is beneficial to my team while harming yours.  Perhaps you could take small day trips when the Chiefs are playing?
